    • Method Detail

      • putInShelf

        public void putInShelf(Food food)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Usually, a Food is placed into the Shelf which has the same temperature properties as the Order of the Food. In case that the Shelf talked above is full, the Food is placed into the Overflow Shelf if it has free room. Otherwise, we determine the behavior in two cases. First, find all kinds of temperatures with existing Food in Overflow Shelf, then determine which Shelf among these temperatures has more that zero free room and has the maximun free room. If such one exists, move a Food with allowable temperature from Overlow Shelf to that Shelf, then place the new Food into Overflow Shelf. Second, if no shelf talked above exists, find the food with lowest value in Overflow Shelf, discard it, then place the new Food into Overflow Shelf.
        Parameters:
        food - The food just received
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throw Exception if the order has an unsupported temperature

      • takeFood

        public Food takeFood(Order order)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Take a food out of shelf. First try to find the food from the shelf with the same temperature as the order, if not found, then try to find from Overflow shelf
        Parameters:
        order - The order that the food to take corresponds to
        Returns:
        Return the food if found, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throw Exception if the order has an unsupported temperature
